newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: Abidjan blue-chip index rises again on week.
newsitem.headline: Abidjan blue-chip index rises again on week.

text.p: The Abidjan Bourse's blue-chip index rose in the week to Friday, taking its rise in value in 1997 so far to 32.19 percent, the market report showed.

The 12-VB blue chip index rose 1.93 percent on the week to 319.89, boosted by a rise in the shares of bank BICICI, up 4,620 CFA francs to 49,870 CFA francs, NESTLE, up 3,430 CFA francs to 71,100, tobacco company SITAB up 2,770 CFA francs to 58,270 CFA francs, and bank SGBCI up 2,100 CFA francs to 23,000 CFA francs.
The All-share index rose 1.66 percent to 448,62 taking the 1997 rise to 25.38 percent. In the previous week the all share index rose 3.13 percent to close at 441.29 points.
The total turnover dipped to 5,906 shares worth 161,195,290 CFA francs down from 9,896 shares worth 773,323,210 CFA francs. Tobacco company SITAB made up 23.20 percent of the volume traded.
The main fallers were rubber manufacturer SOGB down 1500 CFA francs to 16,000 and palm oil producer SAPH, which fell 710 CFA francs to 13,670.
